text:
(1)
Roosevelt street, north from, and including Water Street, showing in the background the 'Second and Third Aves. Elevated lines on New Bowery.

October 28, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing a closer view of the N.E. corner of Roosevelt and Water Streets. The corner building is Nos. 114 Roosevelt and 300 Water Streets. The adjoining buildings on the Water Street side, are Nos. 332-334.

September 9, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, showing the lower parts of buildings seen in No. 2.

September 9, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Roosevelt street, north from, and including Water Street, showing in the background the 'Second and Third Aves. Elevated lines on New Bowery.

(2)

(1)
Roosevelt street, north from, and including Water Street, showing in the background the 'Second and Third Aves. Elevated lines on New Bowery.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing a closer view of the N.E. corner of Roosevelt and Water Streets. The corner building is Nos. 114 Roosevelt and 300 Water Streets. The adjoining buildings on the Water Street side, are Nos. 332-334.

(3)
The same, showing the lower parts of buildings seen in No. 2.

September 9, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

Roosevelt Street, west side, north from Water, to Cherry Streets. In the foreground, is a 3-story frame house, No. 318 Water Street. The 4-story building in the foreground, is No. 45 Cherry Street, at the S.W. corner of Roosevelt Street. The three 3-story buildings in the center of the view, are Nos. 115 to 111 Roosevelt Street.

September 7, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Water Street, west from and including Roosevelt, to but not including Dover Streets. The building on the N.W. corner is a frame house. The Brooklyn Bridge is seen in the background. Also shown is Roosevelt Street, at Water Street. Note the Jerry McAuley Mission at Nos. 312-314, west of Roosevelt Street. The buildings on either side of said Mission are 1-story structures. Water Street changes its direction to run arbitrarily north and south when south of the Brooklyn Bridge.
September 7, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
320 Water Street, adjoining the N.W. corner of Roosevelt Street. Building shown is a 1-story frame structure. Note new building occupying the corner site, formerly a 3-story frame house. On the left appears a portion of the Jerry McAuley Mission.
1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.

(3)
ASSUMING STREET
Similar to No. 1.

P. L. Sperr.

March 20, 1936.

(1)
Water Street, west from and including Roosevelt, to but not including Dover Streets. The building on the N.W. corner is a frame house. The Brooklyn Bridge is seen in the background. Also shown is Roosevelt Street, at Water Street. Note the Jerry McAuley Mission at Nos. 312-314, west of Roosevelt Street. The buildings on either side of said Mission are 1-story structures. Water Street changes its direction to run arbitrarily north and south when south of the Brooklyn Bridge.
September 7, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
320 Water Street, adjoining the N.W. corner of Roosevelt Street. Building shown is a 1-story frame structure. Note new building occupying the corner site, formerly a 3-story frame house. On the left appears a portion of the Jerry McAuley Mission.
1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.

(3)
ASSUMING STREET
Similar to No. 1.

P. L. Sperr.

March 20, 1936.

(1)

Also shown is Roosevelt Street, at Water Street. Note the Jerry McAuley Mission at Nos. 312-314, west of Roosevelt Street. The buildings on either side of said Mission are 1-story structures. Water Street changes its direction to run arbitrarily north and south when south of the Brooklyn Bridge.

ASSUMING STREET
Similar to No. 1.

P. L. Sperr.

March 20, 1936.

Roosevelt Street, east side, north from, but not including Water, to, and including Cherry Streets.
May 3, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

304-310 Water Street, north side, west of Roosevelt Street. Structure is a 1-story building. Note a portion of the Jerry Mc Auley Mission on the right.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.

Water Street, north side, east from and including Roosevelt Street. (Direction of Water Street is arbitrarily set to run east and west from the Brooklyn Bridge to East Street.
April 15, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

349 Water Street, south side, between Roosevelt Street and James Slip. Building shown is a frame shack. (Direction of Water Street is arbitrarily set to run east and west from the Brooklyn Bridge to East Street).

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.

(1)
Roosevelt Street, east side between Water and South Streets, across the clearing on Northeast corner.
(2)
Roosevelt Street, northeast corner and Water Street.

P.L.Speer.
October 8, 1938.

(1)
Roosevelt Street, east side between Water and South Streets, across the clearing on Northeast corner.
(2)

P.L.Speer.
October 8, 1938.
